newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat lower on showers in Kansas, Nebraska.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat lower on showers in Kansas, Nebraska.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures were lower early on showers overnight in key dry areas of Kansas and Nebraska wheat growing regions, traders said.
"We were talking about the rain and they got it. It was a soaking good shower in northwest Kansas," a trader said.
Trading was active with commission house selling met by scale-down cash connected demand, they said.
Refco Inc sold one million bushels of July and E.D. and F. Man International bought one million bushels of September, the traders said.
At 1018 CDT, KCBT hard red winter wheat futures were two to three cents per bushel lower, with July down 2-3/4 at $3.74-1/2.
